original_data.question: A pediatrician notices that 9 of her patients this year have developed paralysis after a flu-like illness. They range in age from 7 to 11, and most of them had no abnormal activities prior to developing the paralysis. These patients concern her because she has not seen this type of paralytic illness in over 20 years of practice. Based on this experience, she decides to write up the initial presentation and clinical course of these patients and publish them in a journal. Which of the following is most likely true about this study?

options.A: Different interventions with 2 or more variables can be studied
options.C: It should be reported in terms of odds ratio
options.D: Participants act as their own controls

model_response:
This is a case series, which is a descriptive study. It is not possible to test a hypothesis using this type of study. It is also not possible to calculate an odds ratio. The other options are incorrect because a case series does not involve interventions and does not have a comparison or control group.

###Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: A medical doctor with specialized training in the care of children.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

A general term most often used to describe severe or complete loss of muscle strength due to motor system disease from the level of the cerebral cortex to the muscle fiber. This term may also occasionally refer to a loss of sensory function. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p45)
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
To show or display; the act of presenting something to sight or view: how something looks.
A term that refers to the nature and/or clinical outcome of a disease (e.g., acute or chronic disease, aggressive or indolent disease, recurrent disease, etc.).
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

"The business or profession of the commercial production and issuance of literature" (Webster's 3d). It includes the publisher, publication processes, editing and editors. Production may be by conventional printing methods or by electronic publishing.
A periodical dedicated to a particular subject.

A work that reports on the results of a research study to evaluate interventions or exposures on biomedical or health-related outcomes. The two main types of clinical studies are interventional studies (clinical trials) and observational studies. While most clinical studies concern humans, this publication type may be used for clinical veterinary articles meeting the requisites for humans.
